summary:
Mireille Heijltjes was born in The Netherlands. She studied at the Conservatory of Maastricht and the Royal Conservatory of The Hague with the Russian concert pianist Naum Grubert. At age 21 she had completed all her studies, including Music Science at the Utrecht University. To continue her piano studies she went to Moscow where she studied for three years with the famous professor Lev Naumov at the Moscow Conservatory.

Already at a young age she performed regularly and won several prices, among which the first price at the National Steinway Competition. In 1993 she was the first Dutch pianist to reach the final round of the International Robert Schumann Competition in Zwickau. 

Since then she has given many concerts in the Netherlands, Russia, France, Germany, Greece, Rumania, Danmark, Belgium and the Czech Republic, as a soloist as well as in chamber music. With several symphony orchestras she played concertos by Bach, Mozart, Beethoven, Strawinsky, Schostakovitch and Khatchaturian. She has performed in several major concert halls, among which the Concertgebouw in Amsterdam, the Spanish Hall in Prague and the Big Hall of the Moscow Conservatory where in 2004 she performed  the second piano concerto by Schostakovitch. 

During a concert tour with the Symphony Orchestra of Pardubice, she played the Triple concerto by Beethoven and the concerto in f minor by Bach in the Czech Republic and the Big Hall of the Concertgebouw in Amsterdam. 

In cooperation with the International Association for Human Values (IAHV) she made two concert tours to India to support the IAHV service projects. 

From 2009 Mireille Heijltjes until march 2015, she was Director Humanitarian Projects of IAHV Netherlands. During this time she gave regular concerts in which the music were directly connected to Human Values. The proceedings of these concerts supported the Euro-a-Day school program of IAHV.

In 2014 she organised a benefit concert with the Hague Philharmonic, conducted by Vladimir Ashkenazy and with Evgeny Kissin as the soloist in Rachmaninov's second Piano concerto. The proceedings of this concert also supported the educational projects of IAHV.

From 2015 until February 2020, she worked as Physician assistant for the Sri Sri Ayurveda company, during which time she deepened her knowledge of the ancient science of Ayurveda.

Since February 2020, she is the Humanistic counsellor at RAP revalidatie, a practise for rehabilitation in her hometown Heerlen.

profile_positions.description:
Over RAP
De gevolgen van een ongeval, ziekte of onbegrepen klachten zijn vaak ingrijpend voor de persoon zelf en ook voor zijn of haar omgeving. Ieder mens heeft daarin zijn eigen unieke verhaal. RAP gelooft dat revalidatie moet aansluiten bij dit verhaal en werkt niet met ‘one size fitts all’ behandelingen. 

Omdat revalideren ook kan gaan over psychische en sociale veranderingen wordt verder gekeken dan alleen de fysieke klachten. Samen met de revalidatiearts en behandelaar(s) gaat de cliënt op zoek naar wat daadwerkelijk werkt, naar de individuele mogelijkheden en een nieuw perspectief, zodat de cliënt de regie houdt over zijn eigen leven.

Humanistisch Raadsvrouw
Een nieuw perspectief is nauw verbonden met zelfbeeld, acceptatie, inspiratie, zingeving, ontmoeting en participatie. Deze laatste vier vormen m.i. een eenheid: ze zijn met elkaar verbonden, beïnvloeden elkaar en kunnen elkaar versterken. Het een kan leiden tot het ander, waarbij inspiratie en helderheid over zingeving aan een zinvolle participatie voorafgaan. Ontmoeting kan de andere drie versterken, eraan vooraf gaan maar er ook het gevolg van zijn. 
Het (her)ontdekken van dat wat inspireert en zin geeft, in het gesprek maar ook als ervaring, is de belangrijkste pijler van mijn werk als Humanistisch Raadsvrouw bij RAP.
profile_positions.title: Humanistisch Raadsvrouw

profile_positions.description:
The International Association for Human Values (IAHV) is a volunteer based non-profit organization dedicated to promoting fundamental human values through education, communications and other outreach programs. Founded in 1997 by H.H. Sri Sri Ravi Shankar, in response to the powerful impact of globalization, IAHV has developed into an international resource for at risk communities around the world dealing with ethnic, cultural and religious tensions.

IAHV Netherlands has been active in supporting various humanitarian projects, and in (co)organizing various events such as the annual conference on Corporate Culture & Spirituality in the European Parliament, the World Youth Forum and cultural and other fundraising event.
profile_positions.title: Director Humanitarian Projects

profile_positions.description: Human Values and music are very closely connected. Therefore I have organized and participated in various events that always included three aspects: expressing the human values through music, raising awareness of the necessity of reviving these values by inspiring speakers and raising money for specific humanitarian projects. Examples are the Human Values Concert in the big hall of the Amsterdam Concertgebouw in 2008, concerts with children and youngsters and piano recitals by myself in which the music and/or the composer are connected to specific values. In October 2014, a special benefit concert took place with the Hague Philharmonic, Vladimir Ashkenazy and soloists Evgeny Kissin and Lilli Paasikivi.
profile_positions.title: Concert pianist and concert organizer
